item.title: JDBC
item.description: SeedStack JDBC add-on provides support for connection to any relational database through the JDBC API.

item.title: JMS
item.description: Java Message Service (JMS) is a Java API that allows applications to create, send, receive, and read messages. SeedStack JMS add-on provides a JMS 1.1 integration (JSR 914).

item.title: JPA Configuration
item.description: SeedStack JPA add-on supports any JPA-compliant ORM to allow your application to interface with relational databases.

item.title: JPA with the business framework
item.description: While you can do plain JPA by injecting EntityManager anywhere, it is better to define an architectural layer where you encapsulate persistence-related operations. In the business framework, persistence is confined to Repositories. JPA repository Default JPA repository The JPA add-on will provide a default JPA repository implementation for every aggregate that does not have a custom one. Two cases may occur: You don’t have any custom repository interface an particular aggregate.

item.title: Transactions
item.description: The SeedStack/Spring bridge add-on allows to trigger transactions across framework boundaries.
